title: Configure GNOME Display Manager
description: Configure GNOME Display Manager security settings

controls.title: Ensure GDM is removed
controls.description: GNOME Display Manager (GDM) is a program that manages graphical display servers and handles graphical user logins.
controls.rationale: If a graphical login is not needed, removing it will reduce the potential attack surface.
controls.impact: Removing the GNOME Display Manager will prevent graphical logins to the system.
controls.remediation: Run the following command to remove gdm3: apt purge gdm3

controls.title: Ensure GDM login banner is configured
controls.description: GDM can be configured to display a login banner.
controls.rationale: Warning messages inform users who are attempting to login to the system of their legal status and may assist the prosecution of intruders.

controls.title: Ensure GDM disable-user-list option is enabled
controls.description: GDM can be configured to disable the user list at login time.
controls.rationale: Disabling the user list makes it more difficult for an attacker to enumerate valid user accounts.

controls.title: Ensure GDM screen locks when the user is idle
controls.description: GDM can be configured to automatically lock the screen when the user is idle.
controls.rationale: Locking the screen when the user is idle helps prevent unauthorized access.
controls.remediation: Configure screen lock settings in GDM

controls.title: Ensure GDM screen locks cannot be overridden
controls.description: GDM screen lock settings should not be overridable by users.
controls.rationale: Ensuring that screen lock settings cannot be overridden helps maintain security policy.
controls.remediation: Configure GDM to prevent screen lock override

controls.title: Ensure GDM automatic mounting of removable media is disabled
controls.description: GDM can be configured to disable automatic mounting of removable media.
controls.rationale: Disabling automatic mounting reduces the risk of malicious media being automatically processed.
controls.impact: Users will need to manually mount removable media.
controls.remediation: Configure GDM to disable automatic mounting

controls.title: Ensure GDM disabling automatic mounting of removable media is not overridden
controls.description: GDM automatic mounting settings should not be overridable by users.
controls.rationale: Ensuring that automatic mounting settings cannot be overridden helps maintain security policy.
controls.remediation: Configure GDM to prevent automatic mounting override

controls.title: Ensure GDM autorun-never is enabled
controls.description: GDM can be configured to never automatically run programs from removable media.
controls.rationale: Disabling autorun prevents malicious programs from automatically executing when removable media is inserted.
controls.impact: Programs on removable media will not automatically execute.

controls.title: Ensure GDM autorun-never is not overridden
controls.description: GDM autorun settings should not be overridable by users.
controls.rationale: Ensuring that autorun settings cannot be overridden helps maintain security policy.
controls.remediation: Configure GDM to prevent autorun override

controls.title: Ensure XDMCP is not enabled
controls.description: X Display Manager Control Protocol (XDMCP) is designed to provide authenticated access to display management services for remote displays.
controls.rationale: XDMCP is not a secure protocol and should not be used in security-conscious environments.
controls.impact: Remote graphical logins will not be possible via XDMCP.
controls.remediation: Ensure XDMCP is disabled in GDM configuration

controls.title: Ensure Xwayland is configured
controls.description: Xwayland provides X11 compatibility for Wayland compositors.
controls.rationale: Proper Xwayland configuration helps maintain security in graphical environments.
